title: Modelling an electrolyser in a graph-based framework
authors: Buu-Van Nguyen, Johan Romate and Cornelis Vuik
abstract:
We propose an electrolyser model for steady-state load flow analysis of
multi-carrier energy networks, where the electrolyser is capable of producing
hydrogen gas and heat. We show that there are boundary conditions that lead to
a well-posed problem. We derive these conditions for two cases, namely with a
fixed and non-fixed ratio between gas and heat output. Furthermore, the derived
conditions are validated numerically.
